009package imagingbook.common.math;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014/**
015 * This code is volatile, don't use yet!
016 * 
017 * @author WB
018 * @version 2021/08/26
019 */
020public class ChiSquaredDistance {
021        
022        public static double distance(double[] P, double[] Q) {
023                if (P.length != Q.length) {
024                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("vectors P, Q have different lengths");
025                }       
026                double sum = 0;
027                for (int i = 0; i < P.length; i++) {
028                        double denom = P[i] + Q[i];
029                        if (!isZero(denom)) {
030                                sum = sum + sqr(P[i] - Q[i]) / denom;
031                        }
032                }
033                return 0.5 * sum;
034        }
035        
036        // ------------------------------------------------------------------
037        
038        private static void testDistance(double[] P, double[] Q) {
039                System.out.println();
040                System.out.println("P = " + Matrix.toString(P));
041                System.out.println("Q = " + Matrix.toString(Q));
042                System.out.format("D(P,Q) = %.6f\n", distance(P, Q));
043                System.out.format("D(Q,P) = %.6f\n", distance(Q, P));
044                
045                System.out.format("D(P,P) = %.6f\n", distance(P, P));
046                System.out.format("D(Q,Q) = %.6f\n", distance(Q, Q));
047        }
048
049        public static void main(String[] args) {
050                {
051                        double[] P = {1, 2, 13, 5, 45, 23};
052                        double[] Q = {67, 90, 18, 79, 24, 98};
053                        testDistance(P, Q);
054                }       
055                {
056                        double[] P = {91, 900, 78, 30, 602, 813};
057                        double[] Q = {57, 49, 36, 759, 234, 928};
058                        testDistance(P, Q);
059                }
060                
061        }
062}
